claim: Friedrich Hayek, a person from America, won a Nobel Prize for Economics.

supporting.text: Friedrich Hayek was awarded the Nobel Prize in Economic Sciences in 1974 for his pioneering work in the theory of money and economic fluctuations.

attacks.text: Friedrich Hayek was awarded the Nobel Prize in Economic Sciences in 1974 for his pioneering work in the theory of money and economic fluctuations.
Friedrich Hayek was not from America; he was born in Austria and later became a British citizen.
While Hayek was not American, the claim does not explicitly state he was born in America, only that he was 'a person from America,' which could imply he lived or worked there.
Hayek did spend significant time in the U.S., including teaching at the University of Chicago, which might qualify him as 'a person from America' in a broad sense.
